intro: Odollamia malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
